label: AB3_tI16_140_b_ah-001
title: $\alpha$-SiU$_{3}$ ($D0_{c}$) Structure
comments:
This is the ground state of SiU$_{3}$.  Above 770$^\circ$C it transforms into $\beta$-SiU$_{3}$ in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3_cP4_221_a_c-001}{Cu$_{3}$Au ($L1_{2}$) structure.} (Okamoto, 2013). 
 When $c=2 a$ and $x_{3}=1/4$ the atoms are at the positions of the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3_cP4_221_a_c-001}{Cu$_{3}$Au ($L1_{2}$) structure}. 
 Many references define both a $D0_{c}$ and a $D0'_{c}$ (Ir$_{3}$Si) structure. The primary difference seems to be positioning the Si atoms on the (2a) or (2b) sites. Since this is merely an origin shift we will ignore the $D0'_{c}$ label.
